partintro.para: Remoting Plugin is composed of sample codes to guide basic usage of HTTP Invoker among remote technologies (RMI, Hessian/Burlap, HTTP Invoker, etc.) supported by Spring Remoting and necessary reference libraries.
Install remoting-plugin by entering the following command in the Command window.
The installation result can be checked by using the installed (mvn anyframe:installed) or the jetty:run (mvn clean jetty:run) commands.

book.part:
Spring Remoting
Remoting is communication among services provided by client application and remote application.
Remoting technology supported by Spring Remoting are as follows.
Remoting Technology
Description
RMI(Remote Method Invocation)
Used to open or access Java-based service when there are no network limitations such as firewall.
Hessian/Burlap
Used to open or access Java-based service when there are network limitations such as firewall.
HTTP Invoker
Used to open or access Spring-based service when there are network limitations such as firewall.
Merits and Demerits of Spring Remoting Technology
Remoting Technology
Merits
Demerits
RMI
Can transfer complex data types on network because it supports the Java object serialization mechanism.
A Java to Java solution that cannot use HTTP protocal. A separate RMI compiler and registry is needed.
Hessian/Burlap
No firewall problems.
Has it's own serialization mechanism, so it is hard to use complex data types. Burlap only supports Java client.
HTTP Invoker
Easy to use HTTP-based Remoting technology.
A Java to Java Remoting solution. Server and client should be implemented by Spring application.
EJB
JavaEE service for Remoting, application security, transaction processing, etc.
Heavyweight technology. JavaEE container is essential.
Web Services
Independent in platform and language.
Uses SOAP, and needs engine for running web service.
